text.section:
The Executive Director or any officer or employee of the Administration designated by the Executive Director may conduct investigations, inquiries, and hearings as to:
Any matter covered by this title or by a rule, regulation, or order of the Administration; or
Any aeronautics accident in this State.

Hearings shall be:
Open to the public; and
Except as provided in § 5-210 of this subtitle, held on such notice as the Executive Director considers advisable.

The Executive Director or his designee may:
Administer oaths;
Certify to all official acts; and
Issue subpoenas and orders for the attendance and testimony of witnesses and the production of papers, books, and documents.

section.section: If a person fails to comply with any subpoena or order issued under this section, the Executive Director or his designee may invoke the aid of a court of competent jurisdiction.
The court may order that person to obey the subpoena or order or to give evidence about the matter in question.
